sections.heading: This Act shall be known and may be cited as the Homelessness Prevention Act.
sections.text: This Act shall be known and may be cited as the Homelessness Prevention Act.

sections.heading: Legislative findings.
sections.text:
The General Assembly finds that
homelessness frequently
results from a temporary economic crisis such as a temporary loss of
employment, medical emergency, or loss or interruption of public benefits.
It is also found that the prevention of homelessness, as
opposed to providing temporary shelter or offering other short-term solutions
to
persons who become homeless, is cost-effective, preserves family
self-respect and helps to keep families intact.

sections.heading: Grant eligibility.
sections.text:
The Department shall award grants to grantees
that agree to focus their emergency response
systems on homeless prevention and securing permanent or transitional housing
for homeless households. The Department shall consider the extent to which the
proposed project activities demonstrate ways in which existing resources in a
service area may be more effectively coordinated. Priority in awarding grants
will be given to applicants participating in an established continuum of
care.

sections.heading: Staff accepting applications; training and experience.
sections.text:
A
grantee's staff accepting applications from households for
assistance under the program shall be trained or
experienced in the following: the operation of the program and any
regulations adopted in relation to the program by the Department;
identification of federal,
State and local agencies and services which are relevant to the program and
the program's clients; dissemination of information relating to the
program; intake, screening and referral procedures; and other areas to be
determined by the Department. If the Department contracts with a private
entity for the operation of the program, the Department shall ensure that
the staff of the entity have experience and training as specified in this
Section.

sections.heading: Consultation.
sections.text:
Grantees shall
consult on a regular basis with the local established continuum of care
in preparing the
project proposal and in the design, implementation, and evaluation of the
project.

sections.heading: (a) Program staff shall, whenever practicable, negotiate
sections.text:
with the landlord of a household approved for assistance under the program
to enable the household to remain in its current housing.

sections.heading: The program shall provide for outreach to persons who are
sections.text:
likely to be in need of assistance. Such outreach may include, but shall
not be limited to, general publicity, and cooperation with other agencies
and court and sheriff's personnel involved in eviction matters.

sections.heading: Assistance received under this Act shall not be considered
sections.text:
to be income in determining a recipient's eligibility for other State
assistance programs or for State tax purposes.

sections.heading: Administrative costs and case management expenses
sections.text: On an annual basis, a grantee's administrative costs and case management expenses shall not exceed 20% of the grant amount it receives under the Act.

sections.heading: Report.
sections.text:
The Department shall report on program activities
that provide assistance or services to homeless persons under this Act as part
of its annual report to
the General Assembly.
